intro: Schaueria parviflora, commonly known as the small-flowered Schaueria, is a species of flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its compact growth habit and small, delicate flowers that typically bloom in shades of pink or white. Schaueria parviflora thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in shaded or semi-shaded environments. Due to its ornamental value and limited distribution, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens and conservation programs.
